title: Sparta school district announces positive COVID tests, suspends athletics for 2 weeks
text:
The Sparta Township school district announced Sunday that positive COVID-19 tests among students will suspend extracurricular activities for the next two weeks.

In a letter sent to parents, positive tests from student-athletes in the football and girls soccer programs were cited as reasons for the actions taken by the district.

“Our intent is to take this action as a proactive measure to protect the health and safety of our student-athletes and our coaches," Superintendent Patrick McQueeney said in the statement. "We are hoping to avoid a potential scenario that could result in a future cancellation of the fall season.”

As a result of the positive tests, the district announced that it was suspending all athletics and activities for 14 days, with practice to resume Oct. 5. According to the statement, students gathering socially could have been the originator of the positive tests, and the district strongly encouraged all students and families to follow social distancing guidelines to prevent another suspension or the possible cancellation of extracurricular activities.

Sparta athletic director Steve Stoner confirmed that the Oct. 2 football game against Lakeland is cancelled and that any boys soccer, girls soccer, field hockey and girls tennis games before the return date are in the process of being rescheduled.

“It was a district decision to nip it in the bud and try to get ahead of this,” Stoner said.
